availability.p: The text of the original document is in the public domain. Subject to certain exceptions, public domain works may be freely copied or used in the creation of derivative works without permission, or authorization, of the former copyright owners.

The text encoding was created and/or prepared by the Walt Whitman Archive and is governed by a Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License (CC BY 4.0). Permission to reproduce the graphic images of the original item has been granted by the owners of the original for this publication only.

note.p: This manuscript fragment seems to have functioned partly as reading notes and partly as draft material for the "George Fox (and Shakspere)" section of "Notes (such as they are) founded on Elias Hicks." The essay was first published in November Boughs (1888) and later reprinted in Complete Prose Works (1892).

body.p: George Fox—born 1624‸(8 years after the death of Shakspere)—Lancashire
son of a weaver—G. F. himself a shoemaker
In the midst of that (17th century) George Fox born & flourish'd

—17th century—stormy ‸fitful & perturbed,—the ‸foundations of the old, the poetic the superstitious, credulous, all broken, the light of the new & of science, hardly yet begun—a strange, wild, fitful, agitating almost crazy centutime—a mad, fierce—crazy time
—the ‸political struggles of the reigns of Charles 1st, 2d and the protectorate of Cromwell were heated to frenzy least 5 religious struggles
